intro: Erigeron trihecatactis, commonly known as the three-lobed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are generally narrow and hairy, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron trihecatactis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
